Record.ClassificationPath: Chemicals_and_Drugs_Kind/Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material/Pharmacologic Substance/Enzyme Inhibitor/Telomerase Inhibitor/FJ5002
Record.BroaderTerm: Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material
Record.Description: A derivative of rhodacyanine with potential antineoplastic activity. FJ5002 inhibits telomerase by interfering with holoenzyme assembly and telomere interaction, thus leading to replication-dependent shortening of telomeres with a concurrent increase in aneuploid metaphases and apoptotic cells. Telomerase is active in most tumors cells, but is quiescent in adjacent normal cells. (NCI04)
